This requirement is for Fisheries and Oceans Canada/Canadian Coast Guard. Title: Permanent elimination of the threat of pollution posed by the vessel MV Caruso. Objective: The Canadian Coast Guard requires the permanent elimination of the threat of pollution posed by the vessel MV Caruso currently located in Marie-Joseve
full_summary:
**Tender Notice**
================

**Title (English)**
-----------------

Permit Removal of Pollution Threat Posed by the MV Caruso Vessel

**Title (French)**
-----------------

Élimination permanente du risque de pollution posée par le navire MV Caruso

**Procurement Details**
----------------------

* **Reference Number**: PW-22-01011168
* **Solicitation Number**: 30003215/A
* **Tender Closing Date**: 8 November 2022, 13:00 (Eastern Time)
* **Contracting Entity**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* **End User Entity**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada

**Procurement Requirements**
---------------------------

* The successful bidder will be required to remove all recoverable pollutants from the MV Caruso vessel, prepare the site for the vessel's dismantling, and dispose of the vessel and its contents at a recognized recycling facility.
* The requirement is subject to the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement.
* The period of contract will be from the date of award to 13 February 2023.
